alert.note: Alert for Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:34AM PST until February 22 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Lighter snow accumulations down to 1500 feet later tonight into early Tuesday morning. * WHERE...Southern Humboldt Interior County, including portions of Highway 36 and higher elevation rural roads around Kneeland. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 7 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to slick, snow covered roads. Chain restrictions will be possible over mountain passes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall rates will occur tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
